canonical_explanation.text: A polygon is a simple closed figure made of line segments. The sum of interior angles of an n-sided polygon is (n-2) x 180 degrees. The sum of exterior angles of any convex polygon is always 360 degrees. Quadrilaterals include parallelograms, rectangles, rhombuses, squares, trapeziums, and kites, each with specific properties related to sides, angles, and diagonals.
rules: Angle sum of polygon = (n-2) x 180 degrees
Sum of exterior angles of any convex polygon = 360 degrees
Parallelogram: opposite sides equal and parallel, opposite angles equal, diagonals bisect each other
Rhombus: all sides equal, diagonals bisect at right angles
Rectangle: all angles 90 degrees, diagonals are equal and bisect each other
Square: all sides equal, all angles 90 degrees, diagonals equal and bisect at right angles

questions.question_text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral?
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a quadrilateral (n=4): sum = (4-2) x 180 = 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: What is the sum of the interior angles of a pentagon?
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a pentagon (n=5): sum = (5-2) x 180 = 540 degrees.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram, opposite angles are:
questions.explanation_correct: A property of parallelogram is that opposite angles are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a parallelogram, opposite angles are always equal. Adjacent angles are supplementary.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram ABCD, if angle A = 70 degrees, what is angle B?
questions.explanation_correct: Adjacent angles in a parallelogram are supplementary. Angle B = 180 - 70 = 110 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a parallelogram, adjacent angles add up to 180 degrees. B = 180 - 70 = 110 degrees.

questions.question_text: Which quadrilateral has all sides equal but angles that are not necessarily 90 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus has all four sides equal but its angles are not necessarily right angles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus has all sides equal. A square also has all sides equal but additionally has 90 degree angles.

questions.question_text: The sum of the exterior angles of any convex polygon is:

options.text: Depends on the number of sides

questions.explanation_correct: The sum of exterior angles of any convex polygon is always 360 degrees, regardless of the number of sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sum of exterior angles of any convex polygon is 360 degrees.

questions.question_text: A square is a special type of rectangle.
questions.explanation_correct: A square has all angles 90 degrees and opposite sides equal (in fact, all sides equal), so it satisfies all properties of a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square meets all criteria of a rectangle (all angles 90 degrees, opposite sides equal) plus it has all sides equal.

questions.question_text: The diagonals of a parallelogram:
questions.explanation_correct: In a parallelogram, the diagonals bisect each other. They are not necessarily equal or perpendicular.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonals of a parallelogram bisect each other. Equal diagonals are specific to rectangles; perpendicular diagonals to rhombuses.

questions.question_text: A trapezium has:

options.text: Both pairs of opposite sides parallel
One pair of opposite sides parallel

questions.explanation_correct: A trapezium has exactly one pair of opposite sides parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A trapezium has one pair of parallel sides. A parallelogram has both pairs parallel.

questions.question_text: The sum of interior angles of a hexagon is ____ degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For hexagon (n=6): (6-2) x 180 = 720 degrees.

questions.question_text: In a kite, how many pairs of adjacent sides are equal?
questions.explanation_correct: A kite has two pairs of adjacent sides that are equal.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kite has two pairs of consecutive (adjacent) equal sides.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram PQRS, PQ = 8 cm. What is the length of SR?
questions.explanation_correct: In a parallelogram, opposite sides are equal. SR is opposite to PQ, so SR = 8 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Opposite sides of a parallelogram are equal. PQ = SR = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: The diagonals of a rectangle are equal in length.
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has diagonals that are equal in length and bisect each other.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a property of rectangles: their diagonals are always equal.

questions.question_text: Each exterior angle of a regular hexagon is:
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of exterior angles = 360 degrees. For regular hexagon: each = 360/6 = 60 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Each exterior angle of a regular n-gon = 360/n = 360/6 = 60 degrees.

questions.question_text: A polygon with 8 sides is called:
questions.explanation_correct: An 8-sided polygon is called an octagon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Heptagon = 7 sides, Octagon = 8 sides, Nonagon = 9 sides, Decagon = 10 sides.

questions.question_text: The diagonals of a rhombus:

options.text: Bisect each other at right angles

questions.explanation_correct: The diagonals of a rhombus bisect each other at right angles (perpendicularly).
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a rhombus, diagonals bisect each other at 90 degrees. They are not necessarily equal.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram, adjacent angles are ____ (supplementary/complementary).
questions.explanation_correct: Adjacent angles of a parallelogram add up to 180 degrees, so they are supplementary.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Co-interior angles (adjacent angles in a parallelogram) sum to 180 degrees = supplementary.

questions.question_text: How many diagonals does a pentagon have?
questions.explanation_correct: Number of diagonals = n(n-3)/2 = 5(5-3)/2 = 5 x 2/2 = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonals of an n-gon = n(n-3)/2 = 5 x 2/2 = 5.

questions.question_text: Every square is a rhombus.
questions.explanation_correct: A square has all four sides equal, which is the key property of a rhombus. So every square is a rhombus.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus has all sides equal. A square also has all sides equal (plus right angles), so every square is a rhombus.

questions.question_text: The exterior angle and the interior angle at each vertex of a polygon are:
questions.explanation_correct: At each vertex, interior angle + exterior angle = 180 degrees (they form a linear pair).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Interior and exterior angles at a vertex form a linear pair and are supplementary (sum = 180 degrees).

questions.question_text: Three angles of a quadrilateral are 75, 90, and 120 degrees. What is the fourth angle?
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of angles = 360. Fourth angle = 360 - (75 + 90 + 120) = 360 - 285 = 75 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum of all four angles = 360. Fourth = 360 - 285 = 75 degrees.

questions.question_text: In parallelogram ABCD, angle A = (2x + 10) degrees and angle C = (3x - 20) degrees. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Opposite angles of parallelogram are equal. 2x + 10 = 3x - 20. x = 30.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Angle A = Angle C (opposite). 2x + 10 = 3x - 20. x = 30.

questions.question_text: Each interior angle of a regular polygon is 135 degrees. How many sides does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: Exterior angle = 180 - 135 = 45 degrees. n = 360/45 = 8 sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Exterior angle = 180 - 135 = 45. Number of sides = 360/45 = 8.

questions.question_text: The diagonals of a rhombus are 12 cm and 16 cm. What is the side of the rhombus?
questions.explanation_correct: Diagonals bisect at right angles. Half diagonals: 6 cm and 8 cm. Side = sqrt(6^2 + 8^2) = sqrt(36+64) = sqrt(100) = 10 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Half diagonals = 6 and 8. By Pythagoras: side = sqrt(36+64) = sqrt(100) = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: PQRS is a parallelogram in which PQ = 12 cm and the perimeter is 40 cm. Find QR.
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2(PQ + QR). 40 = 2(12 + QR). 20 = 12 + QR. QR = 8 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Opposite sides are equal: PQ = SR = 12. Perimeter = 2(12 + QR) = 40. QR = 8 cm.

questions.question_text: The angles of a quadrilateral are in the ratio 1:2:3:4. Find the largest angle.
questions.explanation_correct: x + 2x + 3x + 4x = 360. 10x = 360. x = 36. Largest = 4x = 144 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sum = 10x = 360. x = 36. Largest angle = 4 x 36 = 144 degrees.

questions.question_text: In rectangle ABCD, diagonal AC = 10 cm. What is the length of diagonal BD?
questions.explanation_correct: In a rectangle, diagonals are equal. So BD = AC = 10 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonals of a rectangle are equal in length. BD = AC = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: Each exterior angle of a regular 10-sided polygon (decagon) is ____ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Each exterior angle = 360/n = 360/10 = 36 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For a regular n-gon, each exterior angle = 360/n = 360/10 = 36 degrees.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a parallelogram. The diagonals AC and BD intersect at O. If AO = 5 cm, what is AC?
questions.explanation_correct: Diagonals of a parallelogram bisect each other. AO = OC = 5 cm. AC = 10 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonals bisect each other in a parallelogram. AC = 2 x AO = 2 x 5 = 10 cm.

questions.question_text: Which quadrilateral has both pairs of opposite sides parallel and all angles equal to 90 degrees, but not all sides equal?
questions.explanation_correct: A rectangle has parallel opposite sides and all angles 90 degrees, but opposite sides are equal (not necessarily all four).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rectangle has all 90 degree angles and opposite sides parallel/equal, but a non-square rectangle has unequal adjacent sides.

questions.question_text: The interior angle of a regular polygon is 108 degrees. How many sides does it have?
questions.explanation_correct: Exterior angle = 180 - 108 = 72. n = 360/72 = 5 sides (pentagon).
questions.explanation_incorrect: Exterior angle = 180 - 108 = 72 degrees. n = 360/72 = 5.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram, if one angle is 90 degrees, then all angles are 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: If one angle = 90 degrees, adjacent angle = 180 - 90 = 90 degrees (supplementary). Opposite angle also = 90 degrees. So all angles are 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adjacent angles are supplementary: 180 - 90 = 90. Opposite angles are equal = 90. All four are 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: A quadrilateral has vertices P, Q, R, S. PQ = QR and PS = SR. Which type of quadrilateral is PQRS?
questions.explanation_correct: Two pairs of adjacent sides equal (PQ=QR and PS=SR) is the defining property of a kite.
questions.explanation_incorrect: When two distinct pairs of consecutive sides are equal, the quadrilateral is a kite.

questions.question_text: The exterior angles of a quadrilateral are x, 2x, 3x, and 4x. Find x.
questions.explanation_correct: Sum of exterior angles = 360. x + 2x + 3x + 4x = 10x = 360. x = 36 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 10x = 360. x = 36 degrees.

questions.question_text: In parallelogram ABCD, angle A = (3x - 10) degrees and angle B = (2x + 30) degrees. Find angle A.
How many sides does a regular polygon have if each exterior angle is 40 degrees?
questions.explanation_correct: n = 360/exterior angle = 360/40 = 9 sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Number of sides = 360/40 = 9.

questions.question_text: In a square of side 5 cm, the length of each diagonal is ____ cm. (Use sqrt 2 = 1.414)
questions.explanation_correct: Diagonal of square = side x sqrt(2) = 5 x 1.414 = 7.07 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Diagonal = a x sqrt(2) = 5 x 1.414 = 7.07 cm.

questions.question_text: If the diagonals of a quadrilateral bisect each other, it must be a parallelogram.
questions.explanation_correct: If diagonals bisect each other, the quadrilateral is a parallelogram (this is both necessary and sufficient).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The converse is true: if diagonals bisect each other, then it is a parallelogram.

questions.question_text: The angles of a pentagon are x, (x+20), (x+40), (x+60), and (x+80). Find x.
ABCD is a rhombus with diagonal AC = 24 cm and diagonal BD = 10 cm. What is the perimeter of the rhombus?
questions.explanation_correct: Half-diagonals: 12 and 5. Side = sqrt(12^2 + 5^2) = sqrt(144+25) = sqrt(169) = 13 cm. Perimeter = 4 x 13 = 52 cm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Half diag = 12, 5. Side = sqrt(169) = 13. Perimeter = 4 x 13 = 52 cm.

questions.question_text: Is it possible to have a regular polygon with each exterior angle equal to 25 degrees?

options.text: No, because 360/25 is not a whole number

questions.explanation_correct: n = 360/25 = 14.4. Since the number of sides must be a whole number, no such regular polygon exists.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 360/25 = 14.4 which is not an integer. A polygon must have a whole number of sides.

questions.question_text: In parallelogram PQRS, the bisectors of angle P and angle Q meet at point T. What is angle PTQ?
questions.explanation_correct: P + Q = 180 (adjacent). Half each: P/2 + Q/2 = 90. In triangle PTQ, angle PTQ = 180 - 90 = 90 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: P + Q = 180. So P/2 + Q/2 = 90. In triangle PTQ: PTQ = 180 - 90 = 90 degrees.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a rectangle. The diagonals AC and BD intersect at O. If angle AOB = 110 degrees, find angle OCD.
questions.explanation_correct: Angle COD = angle AOB = 110 degrees (vertically opposite). In triangle OCD: OC = OD (diagonals of rectangle are equal and bisect). So it is isosceles. Angle OCD = angle ODC = (180-110)/2 = 35 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: COD = AOB = 110 (vertically opposite). OC = OD (half of equal diagonals). Angle OCD = (180-110)/2 = 35 degrees.

questions.question_text: The ratio of interior angle to exterior angle of a regular polygon is 5:1. Find the number of sides.
questions.explanation_correct: Interior/Exterior = 5/1. Interior = 5 x Exterior. Interior + Exterior = 180. 5E + E = 180. E = 30. n = 360/30 = 12.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5E + E = 180. E = 30 degrees. n = 360/30 = 12 sides.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram ABCD, angle A = 65 degrees. Then angle D = ____ degrees.
questions.explanation_correct: Adjacent angles are supplementary. Angle D = 180 - 65 = 115 degrees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A and D are adjacent in parallelogram. A + D = 180. D = 180 - 65 = 115.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT true for a square?
questions.explanation_correct: In a square, diagonals are equal (A is true). They bisect at right angles (B is true). They bisect vertex angles into 45 degrees each (C is true). D is false.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A square has equal diagonals, so D (different lengths) is false.

questions.question_text: The sum of interior angles of a polygon is 1260 degrees. How many sides does it have?
In a parallelogram, the sum of two adjacent sides is 25 cm and the perimeter is 50 cm. Is this always possible?
questions.explanation_correct: Perimeter = 2(sum of adjacent sides). If adjacent sides sum to 25, perimeter = 2 x 25 = 50. This is true for any parallelogram.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Perimeter of parallelogram = 2(a+b) where a and b are adjacent sides. If a+b = 25, perimeter = 50. Always true.

questions.question_text: Every rhombus is a parallelogram, but every parallelogram is not a rhombus.
questions.explanation_correct: A rhombus has both pairs of opposite sides parallel (so it is a parallelogram). But a parallelogram may not have all sides equal, so it may not be a rhombus.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rhombus satisfies all properties of a parallelogram. But a parallelogram with unequal adjacent sides is not a rhombus.

questions.question_text: The interior angles of a hexagon are 120, 100, 130, x, 110, and 140 degrees. Find x.
